intro: Thecorchus wauensis, commonly known as the Wauensis thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are borne in clusters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds.
